title.narrative: Increasing member commitment and production capacity

description.narrative:
UCORIBU is an aggregator of rice of 10 affiliated cooperatives in the Southern province of Rwanda. It has a joint venture with the Australian company Intercity Millers (ICM). In 2006-2007 the government offered to privatize its rice factory and UCORIBU mobilized its members to gather the required capital of 100,000,000 RWF. 53,000,000 RWF was mobilized by a limited amount of members, who got 40% of the shares in their name. ICM acquired 60%. The remaining 47,000,000 RWF was payed of in the following years with the revenues of the factory. The Union therefor as 2 speeds: it represents 13,000 members through 10 cooperatives who benefit from the joint venture as their buyer and through annual bonuses. The other group are the members that have invested directly in the joint venture in 2006-2007, when the value of one share was 18,000 RWF. People could however also invest smaller amounts, which had direct consequences for their dividends. UCORIBU is active in rice collection, bulking, processing, briquette production, rice flour and animal feed. The Union hence provides quality seeds to the cooperatives and provides guarantees to farmers looking to access fertilizers on credit. In the action plan, we are working on member commitment, by organizing visits of farmers to the factory, improving financial transparency and organizing coaching activities to increase rice productivity. Agriterra will support UCORIBU in strengthening the Union and it's member cooperatives supervisory oversight capacity, governance and financial management and streamlining the role of youth in member coopearatives.
The project is about increasing member commitment and increased rice productivity of member cooperative farmers of UCORIBU. With Agriterra support,the set objective will be reached through implementation of the following activities: 1)Establishing demonstration plots for 10 cooperative members of UCORIBU through FFS 2)Evaluation of 2017 and 2018 strategic joint action planning event for UCORIBU and its cooperative leaders and staff 3)visit of farmers to Gikonko Rice factory 4)Developing information sheets (leaflets/fliers) containing AGM decisions and season updates and distribute them to members 5)external audit for 2017 UCORIBU and its 10 member cooperatives. The jointly implemented activities between Agriterra and the client will involve 13014 members in total of which 3886 women and 5265 youth. Besides these activities, Agriterra will support UCORIBU and its 10 member cooperatives with Agriterra's financial management training for 10 UCORIBU member cooperatives, Mycoop Training for UCORIBU and its 10 member cooperatives, Supervisory board training of UCORIBU and its 10 member cooperatives,Workshop on Youth inclusiveness and facilitate their exchange visit to Tanzania to learn the hill side rice production. The advisory services and training will involve 159 direct participants of which 50 women and 62 youth.
Increase member commitment, productivity and reduce side-selling.
